1 board game
1 Donald Duck piece
12 wooden pieces 4x3
2 dice
rules

35732.name: Jag lär mig läsa
35732.description:
Learn to read!

This game will help you to spell the pictures right. Help the youngsters in a funny way to learn how to read.

35733.name: Fångarna på fortet
35733.description:
The goal of this game is to collect 4 keys and open the treasure chest and remove as much money as possible.

To get the keys you have to go in to dark cells in the fortress and solve the task given to you.

Contents:
1 board game
30 red keys
30 black keys
104 money
125 cards with riddles
4 blanc cards for your own riddles
1 card with father Foura
10 cards with tasks
1 box
2 dice
6 pieces
1 glass timer
1 chest
1 rulebook

35734.name: Destination Norwich
35734.description:
A game of taxi driving through Norwich. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of Norwich's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

35735.name: Destination Sheffield
35735.description:
A game of taxi driving through Sheffield. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of Sheffield's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

35736.name: Destination South Africa
35736.description:
A game of taxi driving through South Africa. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of South Africa's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

35737.name: Destination World Jr.
35737.description: The latest game in Rachel Lowe's "Destination" series, specifically geared towards younger kids and learning the geography of the world.

35738.name: Tactique
35738.description:
Tactique - A Battle Of Colors

Tactique is a quick strategy game suitable for both children and adults. Players randomly divide a set of 14 cards with varying numbers of red spots, yellow spots, and holes in a 3x3 grid, then alternate placing cards on the stack, scoring points for both players based on the number of spots showing in each color. Winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

35739.name: Zen
35739.description:
Zen is a stacking game -- or tower building game -- where players stack inverted funnels on top of one another.

Before placing a new piece, the active player can actually manipulate the stack in the hopes of achieving the proper balance in preparation for the play.

Multiple Zen sets allow for players to race against one another to see who can get the highest stack in the allotted time.

35740.name: Shaman
35740.description:
From the box top: "'Every journey begins with a single step...' A trivia game about North American Indians. Created and conceived by Canadian Native People. First Edition: Dog Soldier."

Tough trivia game with four players, traveling along a footprint-littered path throughout a North American playing board. Around the edges of the board are cloudy totems and Indian spirit figures.

Spaces on the footpath include "Lament" "No Man's Land" and "Free Throw."

Made by Coup Enterprises of Winnipeg.

35741.name: Bible Bookmates
35741.description: Memory game that involves matching tiles of sequential books of the Bible. Players score 5 points for each matching pair and 20 points extra for collecting four tiles in sequence in any of the the following groups: Law, History, Poetry, Major Prophets, Minor Prophets, The Gospels, Epistles of Paul, General Epistles.

35742.name: Conscience: The Right From Wrong Game
35742.description:
"Conscience is the fun way to learn right from wrong and help your children build the foundation to make the right choices in life!"

Children start making these right choices by rolling a die, moving their pawn, and undergoing questioning on the issues of education, crime, charity, drugs, character, and violence. "Optional overlay for use at parent's discretion to discuss issues of Sex".

35743.name: Fargo-Moorhead Trivia
35743.description: Standard chamber-of-commerce booster game. Roll a die and answer trivia questions about the city of Fargo-Moorhead.

35744.name: The Game of Petaluma
35744.description: Monopoly-styled game promoting the local businesses of Petaluma. In addition to the purchasing of properties and the charging rent to unlucky opponents who trespass, the game features a "Commodity Futures Exchange" where players can "invest" money for potential profit based on chance rolls of the dice.

35745.name: Wonder Number
35745.description: This is both a set of 10 games and a math learning system. The games use a color coded number board which illustrates many mathematical concepts such as place value, primes, factoring, square numbers, multiples and more. Chips are placed bingo-style on the color-coded 10x10 board numbered 1-100. The games vary in difficulty and can be played Ages 4 and up.

35746.name: Per-cento
35746.description: Math bingo game for teaching relationships between fractions, decimals, and percentages.

35747.name: Reddingopoly
35747.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Standard localized re-theme of Monopoly game play, this one for Redding, WV.

35748.name: The Kingdom
35748.description:
"An exciting and educational board game that makes learning the scriptures fun and easy. Players move along the path racing to be the first to reach The Kingdom by answering trivia questions based on Bible scriptures."

"Incorrect answers lead them to "Bible Study", "The Chapel", or, worse yet, "The Darkness", causing them to lose turns."

35749.name: Farm 3-D Memory Match-Up
35749.description:
From the publisher:
Test your memory with this cute mix of fun farm animals! Split each animal top and bottom apart and hide each half under haystack cups, then mix them up and see if you can remember which is which! First person to match the most animals win!

Contents:
- 20 Farm Animal Game Parts (10 complete animals)
- 20 Haystack Cups
- 1 Egg Carton Storage Case

Box Size:
11.25" Length x 5.00" Width x 5.13"H / 1.5 lbs

35750.name: Mäklare
35750.description:
The game where you buy land and build houses.

Under construction you will get paid for how many walls of your house you have managed to build. You can build a gas station, a train station, stores and so on... The player that isn't bankrupt at the end will win this game.

35751.name: Monsterborgen
35751.description: Where is the hidden monster? If you can find him then your chances of winning the game are pretty good. But beware, the castle is full of traps and monsters. This is a fun childrens game.

35752.name: Ormen Långe
35752.description: Ormen långe is a childrens game. Collect wooden pieces of your snake and make it the longest. The winner of this game is the one with the longest snake...

35753.name: Pelle Svanslös Klättra och Kana
35753.description:
In this childrens game the idea is for the cats to be the first to reach the cream. The game is a straight snakes-and-ladders clone with slides replacing the snakes. This means roll and move, ladders bring you forward, slides bring you backwards.

Contents:
1 board game
6 playing pieces (cats from the comic)
1 wheel of movement
rules (printed in lid)

The game was issued in a time when the "Pelle Svanslös" comic was very popular in Sweden, the only national comic of the time that could challenge Disney. Most images in the game are signed Carl-Börje (real name Börje Nilsson, cartoonist and comic magazine editor), the cartoonist who drew the comic, and the whole game could probably be credited to him (given that there is no original gameplay).

The six playing pieces are pictures of main characters from the comic, Pelle Svanslös (the hero without tail), Maja Gräddnos (his girlfriend), Feta Trisse (fat and smart cat), Elaka Måns (mean main enemy of Pelle), Frida (the scatter-brained one) and one of the twins Bill and Bull (the funny and dumb duo, sort of like Dupont and Dupond). A few more characters show on the gameboard and on the cover: Tusse Batong (policeman), Gullan från Arkadien (another good-looking girl-cat) and Murre från Skogstibble (farm cat). There are also some anonymous extra cats on the game board. All pictures follow the comic style perfectly, certainly a main feature of the game at the time.

35754.description:
A wargame about the unsuccessful Russian offensive in May 1942. This is the second attempt by the Russians to gain strategic initiative and to liberate Kharkov. The 1st unsuccessful probe had taken place in March and had been turned into a catastrophe few days later by a German operation, which broke out along the whole Russian front. As a result of this battle the Germans reached Stalingrad in autumn 1942.

The game uses rules of the "WB95" (Great Battles 1939-1945); I-go-you-go system designed for dealing with large battles of World War II. Counters represent regiments (Germans) or divisions/brigades (Russians), one hex represents about 2500m, one turn represents one day.

The game has much maneuver and is rich in dramatical moments.
35754.name: Charków 1942

35755.description:
Pettson arranges a race competition on his farm. Try to find the same picture tile and improve your way to the finish line. First over it is the winner in this game.

This is a children's game with funny pictures from Pettsons world. With a good memory, awareness, being fast and with a little bit of luck is all you need to win this game. Your job is to travel around the board and try to remember were the card is and get some help from mucklorna to get you through this game.
35755.name: Pettson & Findus Kapplöpnings-memo

35756.name: Pelle Svanslös på strömmingsjakt
35756.description:
In this backyard is a battle about delicious fish. You are a cat and you are trying to pick up as many fish as possible, but be aware of the bulldog and bill and bull. The first to take 5 fish to safety will win this game.

Contents:
1 boardgame
4 playing pieces
32 cards
12 fish cards
1 guessing marker
1 black playing piece
1 die
rules

35757.description:
(from the World in Flames: 2008 Annual:)

FiF is an optional rule which introduces variety and greater detail into the construction and repair of units, as well as adding new units and options, yet adding little more complexity to the game (in some cases it's even simpler).
FiF can also be played with America in Flames and Patton in Flames.


Supplement for the World in Flames family, included in the World in Flames: 2008 Annual.
Contains 200 counters and production charts for all the playing countries.
35757.name: Factories in Flames

35758.name: Pippis Ballongjakt
35758.description:
From the children book writer, Astrid Lindgren, we meet Pippi Longstocking. Your job is to help Pippi to collect all the balloons that are flying around. The person who gets the most will win this game.

Contents:
1 Board game
4x10 balloons + 2 of each in reserve
1 colored die
rules

35759.name: Monopoly: Wizard of Oz Collector's Edition
35759.description: You’ve reached the intersection where Park Place meets the Yellow Brick Road… so grab your friends and family, click your heels three times and return to the magical land of Oz. You’ll know you’re not in Kansas anymore with the world-famous MONOPOLY game. Follow the Yellow Brick Road as you buy, sell and trade your favorite locations in the movie from Home Sweet Home, the Emerald City and the Witch’s Castle to the Haunted Forest, Poppy Fields and the Apple Orchard. It’s your turn to have your wish granted, the MONOPOLY way! Game includes 6 collectible pewter tokens - Dorothy & Toto, Scarecrow, Cowardly Lion, Tin Man, Tornado and the Ruby Slippers.

35760.name: Polônia '39: O início da Segunda Guerra Mundial
35760.description:
in English:

Polônia ’39 is about the German invasion of Poland, which started World War II. Even if it can be played solitaire it is designed for two players, where one of them plays the Axis side and the other the Poles. The soviet invasion of Poland (in 09/17) is not taken into account in this game as it was considered that at the time Polands' fate was already sealed.

This game is part of Strategos #4, a Brazilian virtual magazine that can be downloaded from Riachelo Games' website at http://riachuelogames.com.br/miniaturas.html.


Polônia '39 aborda a invasão alemã da Polônia em 1º de etembro de 1939, campanha que deflagrou o conflito. Embora possa ser jogado solitariamente, é um jogo para duas pessoas, onde uma assume o comando das forças alemãs e eslovacas, enquanto a outra, o das forças polonesas. A invasão soviética (da parte oriental da Polônia), em 17 do mesmo mês, não será objeto deste jogo, pois entende-se que, àquela altura, o destino da Polônia já estava selado.

Este jogo é parte da Strategos 4, uma revista virtual brasileira que pode ser baixada do sítio da Riachelo Games em http://riachuelogames.com.br/miniaturas.html.

35761.description:
Sylla was the name of a Roman Consul and dictator; the name of the game is a reference to his person. The designer tried to bring together "Res Publica Romana" and "Saint Petersburg," furthermore playable in one hour.

The players will try to become the premier Consul of Rome. Each of the five years (turns) is subdivided into seven phases in which the players take their actions. It will be semi-cooperative as one player alone cannot influence all parts of the Roman social or political life. They also have to prepare for negative events like epidemic plague or persecution of the Christians and also decadence.

The Ystari games website has downloadable rules for the game for 2 players.
35761.name: Sylla
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide

35762.name: Alphabet Pirates
35762.description: Move your piece around the board and collect letter tiles. Making words from your tiles gains you "ducats" ... the first player to 25 ducats WINS! (woo-hoo!)

35763.description:
Players must climb a route made of cards. They get points for each move they make. The more fingers there are in "holds" (holes on cards) at the end of a move, the more they get points. Performing complex manoeuvres is the key, since each hold is bordered by a color. One finger can only go in one color! Beware, if the cards move, your turn ends.

The route is changed a little bit between each round.

The player with most points after 3 rounds wins.
35763.name: Climb!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 23: Climb

35764.name: Pohaku
35764.description: Twenty-four tiles similar to Quadominios except that the colors red, yellow and blue replace the digits. The rule book includes four games and twenty-six puzzles using the tiles.

35765.name: F-Cartes
35765.description:
F-Cartes is a game for 2 to 10 people that simulates Formula On races with cards.

There are four type of cards: Events, spaces, cars, and teams

The game may by played in 6, 12 or 24 rounds.

35766.name: A Game of Games
35766.description:
So, you think you know games? You are reading the latest magazines, going to the most recent conventions, and perusing the Boardgame Geek? then perhaps you and a partner are ready to take on your knowledgeable opponents at A Game of Games as teams compete to guess titles of games before their learned companions.

The game is similar to Password, but players try to clue the names of games instead of English words, and there are a few additional scoring opportunities.

35767.description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical Dark July Second Edition. depicts the brutal battles fought west of Prochorovka between July 9th and 12th, 1943, during the epic Battle of Kursk.

Four 11” x 17” non-geomorphic maps fit together to form an immense 22” x 34” historical battlefield, covering the famed Hill 252.2, the Soviet trenches to the east, and the Oktiabrski State Farm to the north. Six scenarios—five on the historical map—will test your tactical acumen as either the determined Soviet defenders of the Motherland or the brazen 1st SS Panzergrenadier Division Leibstandarte Adolf Hitler (LAH). Dark July includes rules for hand-held RPG-43 anti-tank grenades, anti-tank mines and ditches, low wheat, tank emplacements, roadblocks, and much more.

Dark July is an expansion module; to play it you will need either Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Motherland or Lock 'n Load: Band of Heroes with Lock 'n Load: Not One Step Back.
35767.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Dark July - The Battle of Prokhorovka

35768.name: Erosion
35768.description:
Each player tries to erode their mountain and generate the most amount of sediment in their delta. Players erode their mountains with the processes they successfully bid on and acquire. The sediment supplied to the delta becomes the coinage used in the bidding process. Mountain uplifts 1,500 meters per turn until one player reaches 8,000 meters or the ACTIVE UPLIFT SHUTDOWN event card is drawn. Then, its a race to see who can erode their mountain away the fastest. When a player successfully erodes their mountain, the game ends.

The winner is the player with the most sediment in their delta (after subtracting away any sediment that remains in their mountain)!!!

To the play the game, you need to print out a copy of the rules, the bidding row, the game cards (the card types include event, process, mountain front, and mountain type), and enough game boards for the number of players that will play. A cool rock and a cup to hold the sediment is also needed. I recommend printing the game materials (except the rules) in color, on 11" x 17" cardstock. You will also need to buy a couple boxes of Jujubees (you can eat them while you play), as they are the "sediment" used in the game. To make the game, I recommend using a paper cutter, a glue stick, scissors (for minor clean up), and scotch tape.

The zip file can be downloaded at:

NOTE: EROSION v. 1.0 is now available for download Woohoo! (5/9/08)
http://www.geomorphish.com/o_stuff/o_stuff.html

just click on "erosion" at the bottom of the page and the download will start.

My students and family members are the only ones who have played the game (hence the ultrea high ratings, they are not comparing it to Puerto Rico). If you have any questions, just ask!

35769.name: Chinesenspiel
35769.description: Chinesenspiel (meaning "Chinese game") is a 19th century German game of the Pachisi family, but simplified so there is only one piece per player. The board layout is similar to the Korean game Yut Nori.

35770.description:
Red Christmas-the CSIR and the Moscow Counteroffensive, December 22-30, 1941, brings the ASL enthusiast directly into the path of a combined-arms Red Army assault. Mixed German and Italian forces try and stave off disaster on the Eastern Front in a series of pitched battles depicted in the module's scenarios.

Historical battlefield maps are what CH is all about and Red Christmas continues that tradition with two new historical maps depicting the villages of Orlovo Ivanovka and Novo Orlovka, situated directly in the path of Stalin's Moscow counteroffensive.

This is not a complete game! Ownership of Beyond Valor is required to use this product. Ownership of Hollow Legions is NOT required. Variant 'Berlin Style' MMC, SMC, SW, and needed Guns are provided for Italian combatants.

Contents: 6 scenarios, 2 historical maps, variant special rules, and die cut color counters.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
35770.name: Red Christmas: Moscow Counteroffensive

35771.name: STORM Operação Tempestade
35771.description: This is a game made in Portugal in 1991 by Fanabri that simulates operation Desert Storm .

35772.description:
Bimmelkette
Bell-Ringing Chain (English translation)

By throwing dice players collect wooden beads and wooden animals as indicated on their task cards, comparing their colors and threading them on a colored shoestring with a bell tied in the middle.

The players try to complete their chain in the right order to match the picture by means of luck and manual dexterity.

Dice with colored circles are used to determine whether the player can thread a certain color or collect a bead or animal from the box, depending upon the variation played.

Three games variations are outlined: "grundspiel" or basic; "mischfarben" or blended colors; and "symmetrie" or symmetry.

The player who is first to right the bell of his/her completely threaded and correctly ordered chain is the winner.
35772.name: Bimmelkette

35773.name: Dice GOLF Game
35773.description: AIM : To complete 9 or 18 holes , using the dice to make your way around the course, with the lowest score possible (to play 18 holes, turn around at hole 9 and proceed back to hole 1 ) .

35774.name: It Was a Dark and Stormy Night
35774.description:
Players or teams move their markers around a board according to the roll of a die. The spaces on the board are 12 categories of literature. A marker lands on a category, the first few lines from a work in that category are read, and the player with that marker tries to identify the work. The first player or team to identify eight works wins.

Equipment
» Game board
» 4 player pawns
» 30 book tokens
» 12 categories of clue cards with divider cards
» Die

35775.name: Be-Rhymed!
35775.description:
The symbol on the die determines whether a player will speak his clues, act out his clues, or draw his clues. He draws a card and, using only the specified type of clue, attempts to get his teammates to guess the two rhyming but unrelated words (eg, match catch) that are written on the card next to the symbol that matches the symbol on the die.
Run through as many cards as the two-minute timer permits.
Score one point for each spoken rhyme and two points for each acted out or drawn rhyme.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Nominee
35776.description:
The rumor says that a treasure is hidden on this island. You have to find it before your opponents do. You have three playing pieces and need to get them to the treasure first, all of them. This is a childrens game.

Contents:
1 Boardgame
12 playing pieces 4x3
1 dice
35776.name: Piratspelet

35777.name: Resopol
35777.description:
Welcome to the Hotel business. You will be the manager of a couple of hotels in Sweden. Have you what it takes and the skills to be a manager? See your empire grow and be the first to get 5 million and win this game.

Contents:
1 Boardgame
2 dice
6 piccolo pieces
6 plastic top in different colors
128 cards
Green and red hotels
Money
Rules

35778.name: Detour
35778.description:
From the box back:

"Detour is the one-to-one revolutionary challenge.
A stylish new concept in face-to-face strategy games. Detour is a gripping game of skill and fun that's easy to learn and absorbing to play.
Try to collect six discs before your opponent does. It sounds quite simple, but the wheel turns around, the pegs are removed, the deflectors change place. In other words your challenge alters all the time."

35779.name: Scooby Doo och Monstret
35779.description:
Your job is to revel the monster in this castle. You will start at the Misterymashine. In the beginning you have two clues that will help catch the monster. First to revel the monster will win the game.

Contents:
1 board game
5 playing pieces
5 clues
14 monster cards
1 dice
rules

35780.description: Risk clone with a solid, pretty board and cardboard tokens for armies. The board's changed a bit and the rules for conflict resolution are original.
35780.name: Globalny konflikt

35781.description:
Every Car you race will have its own combination of attributes in the areas of acceleration, handling and top speed. These strengths and weaknesses will be tested when you are forced to complete Driving Tests, either as you pass through certain Checkpoints on the Track, or from Events or Maneuvers cards played by your opponents. Fail the test and depending on the card, you’ll need to sacrifice an Upgrade from your Car.

Cars are moving on the Track built from cards and face different combinations of challenges from Checkpoints on the cards.

Theme Decks available are: Beach Blitz, Canyon Rush and Downtown Dash.
35781.name: Need for Speed Trading Card Game

35782.name: Napoleon 1796-1800
35782.description:
Strategic-operational scale wargame about Italian campaigns of Bonaparte in 1796-1800.

Game scale:
1 counter = army/corps/division or commander
1 turn = 2 days

35783.name: Kamchatka
35783.description:
INTRO
Kamchatka (yes, THAT Kamchatka), somehow, has escaped the damage brought by man’s over development of our globe. To this day it remains one of the great unspoiled wildernesses on the planet and one of the most rugged places on the Earth. Located on the Pacific’s Ring of Fire, Kamchatka holds some of the world’s most beautiful active volcanoes. Add to that the earthquakes, mudslides, flooding, and avalanches and it is easy to see why Kamchatka is literally a force of nature.

The fauna is just as imposing: Giant roc-like eagles reign from above (seriously, google Stellar’s Eagles-these things are unreal!); huge sockeye salmon are plentiful in the many rivers and waterways; walrus and seals live and breed along the shores; herds of reindeer number in the thousands; and there is a greater density of giant grizzly bear in Kamchatka than anywhere else in the world.

GAME
In Kamchatka you must fight to survive. Time stands still here: You play an indigenous hunter hundreds—even thousands—of years ago surrounded by Kamchatka’s frigid seas, great rivers, dense forests, and snowcapped volcanic mountains. Your village depends on you and your small hunting party to hunt, trap, and trade in order to search out the resources they need. You will risk your life on this journey through Kamchatka’s harsh bush and in its treacherous seas to bring back the required resources to your villagers.

Kamchatka is designed to play solitaire or for 2 to 4 players.

35784.name: Budapeszt 1945
35784.description:
In January 1945 Germans made last offensive in WWII trying to de-blockade Budapest in Hungary.

The game uses rules of the "WB95" (Great Battles 1939-1945) system designed for dealing with large battles of World War II. Counters represent regiments (Germans) or divisions (Russians), one hex represents about 2500m, one turn represents one day.

35785.name: Dave Mattingly's Baseball
35785.description:
A simple roll dice and guess result to score points.

Contents:
1 felt Baseball field
1 bat
3 runner markers (blue)
4 scoring markers (2 white, 2 red)
3 umpire markers (blue)
2 pitching dice
4 hit dice

The batter takes the bat and places it over any three box sections of the batting box. The bat is laid across, up and down or diagonally on the boxes. It should cover 3 squares.
The pitcher roll the two pitching dice to determine where the pitch went.
If the bat is not in the section of the pitch, the batter is out, otherwise the ball is hit and the batter rolls the four hit dice to see what type of hit he has gotten.
A roll of one ball equals a single, two balls are a double, three a triple and four balls are a home run.

The Sport Dice is a collection of sport, there are Basketball, Football, Boxing and Golf.

35786.name: Magnetic Space-Venture
35786.description:
A very simple roll-and-move game played with magnetic pawns on a small 'travel' gameboard. Players roll to move, check to see if they landed on a space with instructions and then resolve the instructions, if any.

No decisions made by any player.

35787.description:
Spanish Fury-Hell on the Eastern Front brings the ASL enthusiast to the chaos of the Eastern Front during late 1941 as Axis satellite troops attempt to stave off a resurgent Red Army.

Historical battlefield maps are what CH is all about and Spanish Fury continues that tradition with two new maps, including a long, unique riverside of the Vulkhov River, with two villages, Russa and Sitno, to fight for, and contest the terrain between.

This is not a complete game! Ownership of Beyond Valor is required to use this product. A set of new MMC counters depicting the 250th 'Blau' Division, complete with accurate shoulder patch emblems, are included, along with Sturmboot, Wagon and guns, a total of 192 color die cut counters!

Contains: 8 scenarios, 2 maps, variant special rules, and 192 die cut color counters.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader and Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 (both required)
35787.name: Spanish Fury: Hell on the Eastern Front

35788.name: Yhdistä sana ja kuva
35788.description: An educational domino-like game with puzzle-like pieces for children. All pieces include a word and a picture; they can be placed next to each other only if the two match.

35789.name: Kiekko GaMes
35789.description: A Finnish hockey trivia game with questions about the following leagues and tournaments: SM-liiga, I-divisioona, NHL, IHWC, Canada Cup, Olympic Games, women's SM-liiga and hockey rules. By answering questions correctly one can place player cards (with real Finnish player names) to the rink, whereas wrong answers lead to the penalty box.

35790.name: Viisasten kivi
35790.description: A Finnish trivia game where players try to climb the rock on which the philosopher's stone (Viisasten Kivi) lies.

35792.name: Valencia
35792.description:
This one is my first game design and was a finalist in the Hippodice competition. For those having the desire, time and energy to put it all together, the files are here for print and play. You will need to supply money.

A summary of the idea:

The Game
You have been hired to go to the island of Valencia and acquire crystals before your opponents. You will meet the various personalities that make up the island and must bribe, steal or buy to accomplish your mission. However, others will be attempting to do the same. So, be smart. First you must try to earn the ear of the council person to tell you where the best deal in town can be found. Only the highest bidder will get the location known only to them. Being a smart treasure seeker, you may follow quietly and search the area around where the high bidder goes. Unfortunately for everyone, people only have a limited number of crystals. Once a site has been visited, no one may visit again.

35793.name: Fall nicht vom Hocker
35793.description:
Content:
board, 4 pawns in 4 colors, 1 number die, 1 color die

Each player tries to get opponents to fall off of the stool without falling off of the stool themselves.

35794.name: Bunte Reihe
35794.description:
Content:
tiles with the value 1-6 or different colors, 1 die with numbers, 1 die with colors

The players are landscape planners. They have tiles to get rid of them and to form a landscape with them.

The first player to get rid of his plates wins.

35796.name: Bienenkorb
35796.description:
Content: board, 1 die, 4 pawns in 4 colors

The honey bees collect honey in order to bring it to the bee queen. Each of them like to be the fastest.

35797.name: Bamse 5:an
35797.description:
Children´s game featuring Swedish cartoon bear Bamse and his friends. The 56 cards are evenly distributed between players. In order, each player turns up the top card of his/her deck and plays it on the table. Each card features 1, 2, 3 or 4 pictures of one of the characters. When a player´s card adds the fifth picture of the same character to the table, that player picks up all the cards from the table and adds them to the bottom of his deck. Then the next player plays his top card.

As players lose their last card they are eliminated form play. The winner is the last player with cards remaining.

A very simple card game without decision making, much like War and similar games.

Contents
56 cards
2 additional cards with rules

35798.name: Quiz & Co. Europa
35798.description:
Content: 31 cards with 8 questions and answers each, packed together in a fan

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

The "Reise"-Edition (traveling) has questions about the European states.

35799.name: Near vs Normal Chess
35799.description:
Near vs Normal Chess pits pieces following Near Chess rules against those following normal chess rules. Either black or white side can play with the Near Chess rules, while the other side plays with regular chess rules. Players need to decide at the start of the game which pawn promotion and win conditions are used (Near or normal chess rules).

People are encouraged to either download the rules here or read the rules on the Chess Variants website:
http://www.chessvariants.org/index/msdisplay.php?itemid=MSne...

35800.name: Playoff
35800.description:
Playoff is a fast paced discard game similar to Crazy Eights. It is played on a mat and uses a special deck of cards.

Play a card that matches the suit or value of the previous played card. If a player is unable to do so, cards must be drawn until there is a legal play, and the player pays one chip to the pot for each card drawn.

The eights in the deck are replaced by 'star' cards, which allows players to change suit and collect the current pot. The player with the most chips wins.

In 1976 a version featuring Jack Klugman and Tony Randall, The Odd Couple, was published, with Klugman and Randall cards in the deck.

35801.description:
A game of Merchants and Builders in Old Pisa
In Pisa during the fourteenth century gold rules over all. The great families of the city are the route to success, wealth, and power. Merchant houses compete to make deals with the great families and earn the greatest profits. Meanwhile, master builders erect splendid palaces, marvelous tower houses, beautiful plazas, and fabulous shops, hoping to impress the great families and earn prestige. The center of this quest for wealth and prestige is the Lungarno district, along the banks of the River Arno. Can you overcome your rivals to dominate the Lungarno and become the richest merchant in Pisa?

Overview:
Using tiles, you will build the various districts of Lungarno, sending your merchants to trade with the four great families (represented by shields of different colors). When a district is complete, you will earn profits for your merchants, based on the prestige of the families in that district.
At the end of the game, the player with the most gold is the winner!

Components:

13 Special board pieces
65 Building tiles
55 Florin coins (20 yellow - worth 5 and 35 Grey)
25 Merchants (5 of each color)
12 Privilege tokens
Rulebook




Expanded by:


Lungarno: Luminara
35801.name: Lungarno

35802.name: Monopoly: Augsburg
35802.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Augsburg, in Germany.

35805.name: Belly Up
35805.description:
A variation of the Monopoly-style investment game. The goal: to become the wealthiest player by purchasing investments and collecting investment returns from other players.

Game equipment includes a game board, dice, six playing pieces, play money, "ownership markers", "investment broker" charts, and economy / world affair cards.

Players roll two dice to move around the board. Actions are dependent on where the player lands and can include buying or selling different types of investments, doubling your investment, trading in your automobile, drawing a card and following the instructions, or following other instructions on the board.

If a player runs out of funds and is unable to meet the obligations of any creditor, they have gone "belly up." The last player left is the winner.

35806.name: Deep Blue Death
35806.description:
Deep Blue Death is a simple "beer & pretzels" wargame for two players. Each player controls a fleet of submarines and decoys by issuing a limited number of orders each turn. Players must manage their resources carefully to win. Victory conditions depend on the scenario.

The PDF includes rules, counters, scenarios and a map.

From the publisher's website:
In the year 2020 mankind finds themselves with little but submarines after a terrorist attack. Use your sonar to distinguish between subs and decoys. Fire rocket powered torpedoes through the water at 200 miles per hour! Dodge enemy torpedoes with noisemakers or evasive maneuvers. But manage your resources carefully; when you’re out of torpedoes, you’re just a target.

35808.name: Monopoly: Flemish Edition
boardgameversion: Parker Brothers small white box edition
Waddington / deSka long red box edition
35808.description:
This is a Flemish version of the Monopoly Game. The game was published bij deSka from Brussels. Gameplay is the same as the original Monopoly.

Places on the board:
Go: Start
Free Parking: Vrij Parkeren
Gaol: Gevangenis
Go To Gaol: Naar De Gevangenis
Income Tax: Inkomsten Belasting
Luxury Tax: Extra Belasting
Chance: Kans
Community Chest: Algemeen Fonds
Indigo: Leuven, Dieststraat / Mechelen, Bruul
Gray: Leuven, Bondgenotenlaan / Turnhout, Gasthuisstraat / Turnhout, Leopoldstraat
Purple: Aalst, Lange Zoutstraat / Brugge, Vlamingenstraat / Knokke, Kustlaan
Orange: Brugge, Steenstraat / Oostende, Kapellestraat / Kortrijk, Rijselstraat
Red: Tienen, Leuvensestraat / Gent, Kortrijksestraat / Hasselt, Grote Markt
Yellow: Antwerpen, Groenplaats / Brussel, Lakenstraat / Gent, Veldstraat
Green: Antwerpen, Huidevettersstraat / Gent, Vlaanderenstraat, Hasselt, Demersstraat
Blue: Antwerpen Meir, Brussel Nieuwstraat
Railway Stations (Stations): Noordstation, Centraal Station, Buurtspoorwegen, Zuidstation
Utilities: Electriciteitscentraal, Waterdienst

35809.name: Inspeaquence
35809.description:
From the rules:
"If you can speak in sequence you can play INSPEAQUENCE!
Two teams of up to five players each have 60 seconds in which to create sentence style clues to the six words on the INSPEAQUENCE cards.
There is, however, a twist: each player can only say one word on their turn. And they have to make sense while speaking in sequence - hence the name of the game!
The aim of the game:
Each word correctly guessed gains that team a point-ball. To win, simply be the first team to fill up your scoring arrow with the balls!"

There are different versions explained in the rules for if 2 to 5 players or 6 to 10 players are playing.

35810.name: Moon Rocket Express
35810.description: Thrilling adventure among the planets. An educational game designed to provide hours of thrilling entertainment for young astronauts while they become acquainted with this new and exciting race through space.

35811.description:
From the rules:
Do you know the Taster-lots family? You don't?! No wonder; they come from a very distant planet and they touched down on earth by accident. When they visit a supermarket they are overwhelmed by the tons of food because on their planet there is only pink striped slimy sea grass. So they start tasting everything: cheese, chocolate, butter, plums, frozen pizza,
spinach, potato chips, canned fish, raspberry marmalade…
Suddenly their faces go all funny with squares. “I feel really sick!” moans Tim Taster-lots. “I have eaten so much I can't move”, complains Daddy Taster-lots. They all know they have eaten too much. But what should they have eaten and how? Can you help?

Throughout the game you collect the foodstuff that your body needs during the day. Doing so, you should collect neither too much nor too little foodstuff. The food pyramid printed on your stamp sheet shows how much and which foods you should eat during the day. Each little box of the pyramid corresponds to one portion of the foodstuff shown.
Example: Your body needs 4 portions of fruit and vegetables while you should only eat 1 portion of sweets (a portion is as much as fits in your hand).
The aim of the game is to be the first to have checked all the boxes on your nutritional sheet with a stamp.
35811.name: Besser-Esser

boardgamehonor: 2008 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2008 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
35812.description:
From the rules:
"Loaded down with jewels and other precious stones that sparkle and twinkle, the Vikings have just got back from their latest foray. Under a cheering hubbub they unpack the treasure booty and start distributing it. Vikings, keep cool! Don't reach out for your divvy too quickly. Perhaps if you wait, the more precious pieces will arrive on a later ship!?

Aim of the game is to be the player with the most jewels at the end of the game. The players collect equipment cards and as soon as a Viking ship returns from a foray to the village the treasure load is distributed. Whoever has the most suitable equipment cards, and can bid correctly, will win all the jewels from ship's treasure. But watch out, don't display too many cards or be too greedy!"
35812.name: Wild Vikings
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ5: Wilde Vikingen (2008) Wolfgang Dirscherl

35813.description:
From the rules:
"Creepy things are happening at Eerie Castle!
The distinguished Count Gregorius of Eerie Castle has invited the little vampires to a big feast and is serving lush cherry tomatoes with freshly squeezed juice from blood oranges. However the garlic vampires miss their very favorite garlic dish. They are the only vampires in the whole world who like garlic more than anything else! How on earth could the
Count of Eerie Castle have forgotten the garlic?!

Each player is secretly assigned a vampire. On the way to the castle the vampires have to think carefully about how to move in order to avoid receiving tomatoes (=minus points) rather than their beloved garlic (=plus points). As the vampires don't know which color belongs to whom things can get quite thrilling on the way. The aim of the game is to have collected the most garlic thus having the most points."
35813.name: The Garlic Vampires

35814.description:
From the rules:
"The aim of the game is to collect the most fish.
You have to try to gather kitten gangs! Whoever manages to
gather either three identical cats or any three cats on the same colored background, receives a fish as a reward.

Uncover any card and place it in front of you. One by one all
players uncover a card to try to collect a kitten gang of three identical cats or any three cats on the same colored background.

- There can never be more than three cards in front of you.
When it's your turn and you already have three cards, you
have to return one of them face up to the center of the table
and only then can you uncover a new card.

- Instead of uncovering a hidden card you can also take a card
from the ones face-up in the center, except of course for the
one you just placed there.
35814.name: Katzenbande

35815.description:
'Tis the dawn of the 19th century; an age of science, superstition, and witchcraft.
Howling fills the night as a full moon rises over the small, secluded village of Shadowbrook.
Gruesome murders have become a daily occurrence and terror haunts the streets at night. An evil creature has taken up residence here and the countryside is engulfed by a tide of darkness.
But all is not lost…not yet.
A small group of heroic individuals, with the courage and strength to fight, have arrived in town. Some just passing through while others have come with a purpose; but all will be put to the test as they race to save this cursed town from falling into darkness.
It will take a cunning mind and strength of spirit to determine who is friend and who is foe… to solve the mysteries and hunt the beast to its lair.
But the secrets of Shadowbrook run deep. Gossip and rumors run rampant and these few Heroes may soon discover that they are outsiders here and this town is already so rotten from within there is little left to save.

"A Touch of Evil, The Supernatural Game" is a fast-paced game of fiendish creatures, dashing Heroes, and high-adventure.
Each player takes on the role of a unique monster-hunting Hero, racing against time to stop the forces of darkness from claiming another foothold in the world of man. Only by investigating the town and building your Hero’s strength can you hope to hunt down the Supernatural Villain to his Lair and defeat him in an epic Showdown. Players can race Competitively to be the first to defeat the Villain and save the town, or they can work together Cooperatively to defeat a much stronger Villain.

Featuring a gameboard map of Shadowbrook and its surrounding countryside, eight Heroes to choose from, and four different Supernatural Villains to hunt; each with its own host of unique Minions and powers to drastically change the game.
A Touch of Evil is designed to create an adventurous cinematic feel as the story and game unfolds.

So grab up your Wooden Stake, stuff some shot in that Musket, and hold onto your Tri-corn Hat; no one is safe from the creatures of the night and no one can be trusted…for inside everyone lies A Touch of Evil.

"Expanded by:"

‘Something Wicked’ Game Expansion
A Touch of Evil: Hero Pack One
A Touch of Evil: Hero Pack 2
‘The Madness’ Game Supplement
'The Allies' Game Supplement
Delion Dryad Villain
Special Edition Soundtrack
Volgovian Nutcracker Villain
The Shadow Witch Villain
'The Coast' Game Expansion
Krampus Villain




Home Page: http://www.flyingfrog.net/atouchofevil/
35815.name: A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: AP Podcast – Episodio 8: La Furia de Drácula
Board2Death Podcast Episode 5 - Introductions Round One
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 007 – Board Game Terms
D6G Episode 19: Monsterpocalypse Captions & A Touch of Evil detailed review
Episode 25:  Clash of Cultures Review - Top 10s with Jamie Keagy of The Secret Cabal
Episode 37 :: Mythos Tales Review + Halloween Stories
Episode 51 - Halloween Special
Episodio 6 – A Touch of Evil y ¿tema o mecánica?
Meeples & Miniatures - Episode #40
NJAGP Episode 27 part 2:Totally Confused Again
OBG 31: Take That!
ScapeTalk 21
Session Impressions: A Touch of Evil
The Gaming Gang Episode 49: Our Halloween Special with A Touch of Evil, Achtung! Cthulhu, and More!
The Spiel #65 - Touching Buffy

35816.description:
A 23-page supplement adding the Royal Netherlands Navy (RNN) and ABDA ships to General Quarters (Third Edition). It includes the RNN Surface Combat Charts, ship logs for both RNN and ABDA, formation cards for Dutch aircraft and three scenarios. There's also an article about a hypothetical British battle cruiser in Dutch service.

The scenarios are:


Brawl in the Badung Strait (ABDA vs. IJN 1942)
Battle of Borneo (RNN vs. IJN 1942, what-if)
Running the Gauntlet (RNN vs. IJN 1942, what-if)


The supplement is only available as an electronic document (PDF).

Expands:

General Quarters (Third Edition)
35816.name: Royal Netherlands Navy

35817.name: American War of Independence Scenarios 2
35817.description:
Includes scenarios, rules amendments and revised playsheets for British Grenadier! miniature rules. The scenarios are:


Lexington and Concord (1775)
Trenton (1776)
Hubbardton: Save the Guns! (1777)
Germantown: Washington's Attack (1777)
Monmouth Courthouse: The Morning Action (1778)
Newport: Pigot's Attack (1778)
Savannah (1779)
Spencer's Ordinary (1781)
Eutaw Springs: The South's Bloody Finale (1781)
Gloucester Point (hypothetical 1781)


Expands:

British Grenadier!

35818.name: American War of Independence Scenarios 1
35818.description:
A selection of scenarios for British Grenadier! miniature wargame rules. Follows a format similar to the scenario books published for General de Brigade.

The scenarios included are:


White Plains (1776)
Oriskany: Twilight of the Iroquois (1777)
Brandywine: Cornwallis's Attack (1777)
Brandywine: Knyphausen's Battle (1777)
Bemis Heights (Second Saratoga) (1777)
Monmouth: Washington Saves the Day (1778)
La Vigie: France's Bunker Hill (1778)
Camden (1780)
Hannah's Cowpens (1781)
Hobkirk's Hill (1781)


Also included are rules addenda, a colour insert with wargaming flags and a revised playsheet.

Expands:

British Grenadier!

35819.name: Proletarians, To Horse!
35819.description:
Army lists and rules amendments for Square Bashing 1914-1918 miniature rules to include battles of the Russian Civil War. A total of 26 different army lists is included. Additional rules include things like propaganda offensives and gunboats.

Expands:

Square Bashing 1914-1918

35820.name: Uncle Duke's Napoleonette
35820.description: Napoleonic miniature wargaming at 1:50 scale with 15mm miniatures. The smallest command element is a Division, miniatures are organized into Regiments. The rules include orders of battle for the 1809 Austrian campaign.

35821.name: To Arms!
35821.description:
Marlburian army lists for use with "None Shall Pass!" wargame rules.

Includes 19 major armies and 22 minor allies. Also has uniform information and a short bibliography.

Expands:

None Shall Pass!

35822.name: John Company and the Conquest of India
35822.description:
A Miniatures Game System for Warfare on the Sub-Continent 1750-1860.

Caters for all miniatures scales with each player controlling roughly a brigade (ca. 50 figure bases). In addition to the wargame rules and army profiles included are a bibliography, scenarios, notes on figure sources and uniform guides.

The scenarios included are:


The Battle of Assaye (2nd Maratha War, 1803)
Desperate Measures: Outside Kabul (1st Afghan War, 1841)
Meeting Engagement at Mudiwal (1st Sikh War, 1845)
The Relief of Luckhipore (Indian Mutiny, 1857)

35823.description:
"Being in the Main a Rules System for Miniature Colonial Naval Wargames, ca. 1860-1914 A.D."

Miniature wargame rules for coastal and riverine warfare for the colonial period. Intended to be used with The Sword and the Flame rules but can be played as a "stand alone".
35823.name: Boilers and Breechloaders

35824.name: The Sword in North Africa
boardgamepublisher: And That's The Way It Was...
35824.description:
A The Sword And The Flame variant for the French Foreign Legion in North Africa. Includes organization charts for the French and Arab/Bedouin as well as additional rules.

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame




Expanded by:

The TSINA Event Deck

35825.description: Skirmish wargame rules for the Napoleonic period. Despite the name the game is not merely focused on the Peninsular war. Three scenarios are included.
35825.name: Once Upon a Time in the Western Peninsula

35826.description:
A selection of scenarios for use with Guns at Gettysburg miniature wargame rules.

The 14 scenarios included are:


Belmont (1861)
Logan's Cross Roads (1862)
Break-Out at Fort Donelson (1862)
Assault on Fort Donelson (1862)
Shiloh Church (1862)
The Hornet's Nest (1862)
Richmond (1862)
Munfordville (1862)
Iuka (1862)
Battery Robinett (1862)
Hatchie Bridge (1862)
Peters Hill (1862)
Chaplin Hills (1862)
Invasion! (hypothetical)


Also includes several pages of optional rules for Guns at Gettysburg as well as conversion rules for players of Johnny Reb 2.
35826.name: Guns at Gettysburg Scenarios 1: Heartland – The Battles for Kentucky and The Tennessee

35827.name: Guns at Gettysburg
35827.description:
Miniature wargaming rules for American Civil War at 1:20 scale. Based on the General de Brigade system.

Includes two scenarios:


Antietam: Opening Attack (1862)
Fredericksburg: Marye's Heights (1862)

35828.name: Napoleonic Scenarios Volume 3: The Glory Years 1800-1809
35828.description:
The third volume in a series of Napoleonic scenarios. Designed for General de Brigade wargame rules but generic enough to be usable with other systems.

The scenarios included are:


Marengo, Part I: The Austrian Breakout (1800)
Marengo, Part II: The Blooding of the Consular Guard (1800)
Marengo, Part III: Desaix's Counter Attack (1800)
Haslach-Jungingen: The Kaiserliks Strike Back (1805)
Austerlitz, Part I: Attack on the Pratzeberg (1805)
Austerlitz, Part II: Attack on Stare-Vinohrady (1805)
Austerlitz, Part III: Attack of the Russian Imperial Guard (1805)
Auerstädt: Davout Against the Odds (1806)
Friedland: Ney's Attack (1807)
Eggmühl: Charles vs. Napoleon (1809)


Also included is an appendix with new rules.

35829.name: TOP GEAR: The Car's The Star
35829.description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the finish space at the end of the board.
As you race around the board, a roll of the dice will reveal a little bit more of a car hidden in the clever hide and reveal unit in the centre of the board. The sooner you guess, the higher the possible points; but beware, once a guess has been made, that's it. A wrong guess scores nothing at all. Players have to decide whether to gamble for an early guess, or to hold fire and try to score extra points for having the correct country, body and engine type cards in their hand. This game includes over 70 large, beautifully photographed classic cars, old and modern. Launched by Top Gear, the hugely successful BBC TV programme.
Game components:
1 x playing board
1 x pack of 72 car cards in full colour
2 x packs of 50 cards comprising;
- Pit Stop,
- Engine Type, Body Type and Country of Origin.
6 x assorted coloured playing pawns
1 x hide and reveal mechanism
1 x 6-sided standard dice
1 x 6-sided coloured spot dice
1 x rules sheet

35830.name: Open Season
35830.description: This is a hunting game that consists of driving out to the hunting lodge, spending 5 days (laps around the lodge area) hunting, then driving back home. Aside from rolling dice to determine how far to move the game is played primarily with a big composite spinner, which determines the outcome of things like shooting game, luck at the horse track, and playing poker. Everyone starts with $300 and 5 credentials. Driving is mostly uneventful except for small financial transactions. Luck "in the field" is determined by flipping over situation cards when you land on situation space. Some cards have animals you can try to shoot at, others have bad luck type situations you need to over come by moving or playing a credential card. Each time a player circumnavigates the lodge (spends one day hunting) they receive a credential and have an opportunity to answer a hunting or safety related question for a cash bonus.

35831.name: Liskosafari
35831.description: A Finnish game where players try to collect a set of lizards for the zoo. Two sets of rules are included: the first one is for adults and children over five and the second one for younger children.

35832.name: Kaktus
35832.description:
Content: board, 4 x 4 pawns in 4 colors

Bugs surround sheltering the buds which start to bloom. Which bugs are the busiest?

35833.name: Bafel
35833.description: Bafel is a Mastermind variant with a few unique twists. You assign numerical values for five positions, and your opponent can ask for the totals of various positions, until someone can guess all the values.

35834.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bayreuth, in Germany.
35834.name: Monopoly: Bayreuth

35835.name: Monopoly: Bielefeld
35835.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Düsseldorf, in Germany.
35842.name: Monopoly: Düsseldorf

35843.name: Monopoly: Karlsruhe
35843.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Karlsruhe, in Germany.

35844.name: Monopoly: Erfurt
35844.description:

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Dortmund, in Germany.

35862.name: Moorhuhn: Zock um dein Leben!
35862.description:
(Taken from a resale webpage, translated into English)

The well-known "Moorhuhn" computer game turned into a funny dice game. Keep your cool, for the life of the animals depends on the luck of the roll. Caution is advised - if a chicken appears, all points and one of the animals are gone. And every player only has three of them ...

boardgameimplementation: The Book of Classic Board Games
35863.description:
15 great games chosen because they are easy to learn, reward multiple playings & appeal to a wide variety of players.... plus, the kids at El Carmelo Elementary liked 'em. :-)

Hoppers / Mini-Hoppers (Halma on a 10x10 and 4x4 board, respectively)
The Game of Y
The Royal Game of Ur
Surround (a Go variant)
Corsaro
Solitaire
Pentominoes
Morris (Nine Men's & Three Men's)
Scatter (Conspirateurs)
Tigers & Goats (Bagh Chal)
Roundabouts (Surakarta)
Fanorona
China Moon
Checkers (Everyday, Giveaway & Super King)
Push Penny Bounce
35863.name: The 15 Greatest Board Games in the World

35864.name: Hanging Gardens
35864.description:
King Nebuchadnezzar II has ordered the construction of a grand terraced garden complex, filled with trees and plant beds, to present to his wife as a gift. As royal engineers, the players compete for the king's favor by offering the most beautiful view upon completion of the gardens.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki

Game System

Piecepack Game System

boardgamehonor: 2008 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended
35865.description:
The object of the game is to obtain the most treasures. Treasures are awarded by completing tasks. Each turn the player turns over the hour glass, then turns over the first treasure card. Depending on the card, various tasks must be performed before the time runs out; pantomiming animals, matching cards, grabbing for specific animals...

If the players wish to push their luck, they can turn over yet another treasure card and attempt to complete another task. If, however, time runs out, the players lose all of the accumulated treasure cards. They can stop after completing a card and retain the current round of treasures they've collected.
35865.name: Auf die Schätze, fertig, los!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 46: Treasure, Ready, Go

35866.name: MARE NOSTRVM
35866.description: Mare Nostrum (MARE NOSTRVM) is a Brazilian game simulating the battles that were fought among Roman and Greek galleys. There is no map. You can play it on the table or floor.

35867.name: From the Gecko
35867.description:
If you love puzzles and games you will love From The Gecko™.

From The Gecko™ is a unique speed math game that focuses the player on understanding numbers and making quick decisions.
Fun for kids of all ages, even grown-ups! Kids will have a blast while learning and laughing. Will you be the first to build your gecko? Great for all ages.

For 2 to 6 players.
Made in the USA.

35868.name: Fun With Colors
35868.description:
Parents and teachers created our products to be effective learning tools, which entertain and educate. The "Fun with™" series of products are designed to stimulate the language and learning skills in young children by introducing two languages seamlessly.

Fun with Colors™ identifies primary and secondary colors, shapes and color association involving familiar objects. It is important to identify objects within each color and ask the child to repeat words and identify objects and colors.

English - Spanish - Box set includes: DVD, workbook and game cards.

Ages 3 and up
2 to 4 Players.

35869.name: Fun With Numbers
35869.description:
Parents and teachers created our products to be effective learning tools, which entertain and educate. The "Fun with™" series of products are designed to stimulate the language and learning skills in young children by introducing two languages seamlessly.

Fun with Numbers™ will help a child learn to count from 1-20 in two languages. The product teaches sequencing and associates a corresponding object with that number. Learning sequencing is an important factor in pre-reading skills.

English - Spanish - Box set includes: DVD, workbook and game cards.

Ages 4 and up
2 to 4 players.

35870.name: Da-Di-Do
35870.description:
"A game of fun for Ages 9 and up,
a must for grades three to five."

An educational game where players roll dice and then add and multiply the pips on the dice. The totals are entered into the player's scoring chart. Players try to fill up particular colours to prevent the other player from claiming that colour. The game ends when one player fills their side of the chart. The the winner is the player with the highest total score. Somewhat similar to Yahtzee.

Contents:
4 Dice
Instructions
Pad of scoring charts.

35871.name: Bible Picture Lotto
35871.description:
Bible Picture Lotto

This is a vintage (1950s era?) religion game.

"Learn Bible stories while you play"

Ages 5 - 10

"Beautiful full-color picture cards with over forty illustrations"

"Six Bible stories"

Includes 6 large picture boards and 36 small picture cards. The boards represent Bible characters like Daniel, Moses, Joseph, etc.

The cards feature objects from the Biblical character's life (Daniel/Lion, etc.) and players match the cards to the correct Bible story.

Warner Press No. T3841

35872.name: BIG FISH little fish "The GREATER than less than GAME"
35872.description:
BIG FISH little fish is a comparing whole numbers game for Kindergarten through 2nd Grade.

BIG FISH little fish is designed to reinforce basic critical thinking skills by comparing whole numbers and co-operation skills by having Players make correct comparisons.

BIG FISH little fish:

44 Number cards
1 Spinner

2 ways to win:

"Everyone is a Winner” - The game is over when each Player has played all their cards.

“Individual Winner” - The game is over when the first Player has played all their cards.

35873.description:
Wooden dowels of the same thickness are placed within a wooden ring and then twisted so they balance on the table. Players roll a colored die which determines which dowel they must remove from the ring (colors are green, orange, and blue). Each dowel is worth 1 point. The player with the most points when the structure collapses (when the ring hits the table) is the winner.

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!>
35873.name: Mini Zitternix
boardgamefamily: HABA Game in a Tin series

35874.name: The Greatest Adventure: Stories from the Bible – Moses
35874.description:
"Journey with Moses as he frees his people from slavery."

"This fun and easy game is intended to help understand the stories, events, and people in the Bible with questions and answers."

"Each player in turn reads a question card. The player turns over the question card to see if the question was answered correctly. If correct, the player moves forward on the game path the same number of spaces indicated on the card."

No spinners or dice are used.

35875.name: Kingdoms of the Middle Sea
35875.description:
Each player takes on the management of an independent kingdom that has its capital on one of the four continents surrounding the Middle Sea. Using military power, economic might and religious influence players vie to increase the size of their kingdoms. Players must also guard against unrest, which could cause rebellion or even civil war to break out. With several paths to victory, players may choose peaceful economic expansion, military invasion, religious unrest or a combination of all three to defeat their rivals.

The requires one piecepack, a box of kitchen matches or small wooden/plastic rods to represent goods, roads and ports and about fifty pennies (or tokens) to represent gold.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35876.name: Kubus Fidibus
35876.description:
from the rules:
"Bobby Butterfingers pulls at his wizard’s coat. This time he must not spoil his magician’s exam. Slowly and carefully, he takes the big magic cube from the pedestal. 'Now, how did that correct spell go?'. Then he remembers. With a firm voice he shouts 'Butterfingers Cube', takes his magic ring and lets it skillfully fall into the cube. The other apprentices hold their breath - if nothing falls out of the cube, Bobby will pass the test.

Whoever can hold the magic cube with a steady hand and skillfully let the objects fall inside, will be left at the end of the game with the fewest objects in front of them."

35877.description:
During his turn a player rolls the single die (d6, distr.: 1/2/2/3/3/4) and moves his car. He must surmount some difficulties named action spaces.
The first player who finishes his 4th round wins the Piston Cup.

The game illustrations are taken from the Disney/Pixar movie "Cars".
35877.name: Piston Cup

35878.name: Butt Head
35878.description: Each player dons a hat covered with Velcro strips marked with different points. There are three sponge balls also covered in Velcro strips so that they will stick to the hats. Several different games can be played with the equipment, rules being provided for six variations. The basic game involves the players throwing the balls at each other until they have all stuck - whichever player has scored the most points is the winner.

35879.name: Coalescence
35879.description:
From the website:

Coalescence is an abstract strategy game in which two to five players manipulate the movements of colossal crystalline nuggets of star-stuff in a spiral galaxy, attempting to create the largest stellar systems and capture them with their immense star-scoops! Can you choose between setting up a sweet chunk of fusion for yourself now, or grabbing a promising patch of space for yourself that might be worth a bundle later?

Each Coalescence set is lovingly handcrafted in Austin, TX. Contains 22" cloth board and 60 acrylic crystal nuggets, and 12 hand-painted wooden capture rings.

35880.name: Trivial Trivia: Idiot Edition
35880.description:
From the back of the box:
Tired of being called an idiot because the rest of the players seem to know something in every category and you appear to know nothing at all? Then this is your chance to change all of that with Trivial Trivia "The Idiot Edition" Trivial Trivia is so simple, you'll feel like Einstein.

With 6 different categories you can play it by itself or spike other trivia games and give yourself the winning edge. Sit back, relax, and enjoy this new style of trivia. It won't give you a headache, but you might get a side ache from laughing!

Contains 50 blue and white trivia cards in a double deck lidded box.

35881.name: Call of Duty Real-Time Card Game
35881.description:
CANCELLED GAME



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Call of Duty Real-Time Card Game will not enter production. This entry currently serves as a placeholder for the announced item and will likely later be removed.




A real-time battle based card game where players deploy 3 soldiers to the battlefield from their squad deck. Action cards activate these soldiers, as they battle it out in real-time. Soldiers fire, move, dive for cover, and attack the enemy, with the first player to a certain number of frags declared the winner. Decks from different countries can be combined to create new strategies.

Two players set up on a 5x5 grid and attempt to win through either earning a preset number of points won by kills or achieve some other mission based objective such as capture the flag. The different "game modes" are quite similar to what one would find in the video game upon which it is based.

The game plays in real time so players are forced to find a balance between speed and strategy. Each player has a deck from which they draw cards one at a time and play them as fast as they can (or discard them if they cannot be played). Certain cards trigger a pause in the action at which time all effects (except movement which is handled as it comes up) are resolved.

Each of the 8 different, but non-collectible, squad decks come with:

60-card deck
8 Soldier cards
2 Mission cards
Double-sided game map
Rules sheet

35882.name: Wonder Garden
35882.description:
From the back of the box:
"This is a most interesting and instructive game. As many children can play as there are cards. Place all of the circular pieces in the center of the table and turn them all face down, then give each player a card. The object of the game is to complete the cards correctly. The first players selects one of the pieces. If it completes a figure in his card this player has another opportunity to draw and continues in this way until he draws a piece which does not belong in his card, which piece is put back on the table face down and mixed in with the others and the next in turn plays in the same way and so on until all have played. Continue playing in turn and the one whose card is complete first wins the game."

Note: Box claims a patent date of July 23, 1912

35883.name: Sentence Builders
35883.description:
Object of the game is to make high score by building a series of sentences with different word requirements. Cards are separated by various parts of speech (color coded. Each player gets a card rack and stores their cards like you would place your scrabble tiles. Instead of making words with letters you make sentences with words.
The game is separated into 6 rounds/ There is different requirements for each round using verbs, nouns, adverbs, conjunction, interjection, adjective etc...
The winner is the player that earned the most points at the end of the sixth round.

35884.name: Takeover
35884.description:
Takeover is a stock game for 2-6 players using a Piecepack set. Players take turns merging corporations (tiles) to increase either short-term cash gains (value-up coins) or long-term stocks that pay out at the end of the game (suit-up coins). The suit of a tile represents its industry; the value of each tile, along with the number of other tiles in its stack, represents its worth.

The rules are available on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35885.name: Silver Isle
35885.description:
Each player represents a nation of Europe seeking wealth from a newly discovered island during the age of colonial expansion: England, Pirate Confederation, Spain or France. After forming the isle, players move colonist crews (coins) across the isle on foot, or around the coast by sea in a ship (pawn). Crews exploring new land on foot claim new property for their port (null tile), may establish a mine (die), and fight enemy colonists. After a mine is established, crews may mine the site and transport silver (tokens) to their colony or their ship. The ship may transport silver and/or crews around the coast of the isle and to Europe (off board).

Silver Isle is played with a Piecepack set and the rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35886.name: MotoX
35886.description:
Pronounced "motocross", this is, as you might expect, a game of racing motorbikes. Using a Piecepack set, the players create a three-dimensional race track with "jump ramps" created by piling coins under tiles in the track. Players roll dice to determine how far they move, but the farther back in the pack you are the more dice you roll. Also unused coins can be used to add more dice to your roll for a turn, or to recover from a wipe-out.

Rules are available on the Piecepack Wiki

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35887.name: Matches
35887.description:
Matches is an easy game that will exercise your memory and deduction, as well as press your luck. It is enjoyable for children and adults, and also plays well with mixed groups of both.

Rules are available on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35888.name: Professor Quizzle's Quiz Wizard Trivia
35888.description:
This is another game that was created in the early 80's to ride the coat tails of the success of Trivial Pursuit. There is no board, so you have to keep track of your correct answers on the handy included notepad. The trivia questions are on very looking familiar cards, and each card also has a category associated with it - go figure.

The most interesting thing about the game is the cute little cartoon of Professor Quizzle printed on the otherwise plain box.

35889.name: Cranium Édition Québécoise
35889.description:
Cranium bills itself as the "whole-brain" game. It borrows from a range of party and parlour games, including charades, pictionary, trivia, and the like.

Cranium Édition Québécoise is packed with quintessentially Québécoise content (written in French). Its gameplay is otherwise more or less the same as the original game.

35890.description:
A deck of cards that adds missions to Risk 2210 (similar in some ways to the way the Mission Deck does in regular Risk). Cards are color coded (in red, amber, and green) for difficulty and the deck can be altered accordingly. Included are rules for various ways of incorporating the 20 card deck into the base game.

Expands:


Risk 2210 A.D.
35890.name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Mission Pack

35891.description:
Introduces a new Aerial Commander to Risk 2210 along with a corresponding deck of Command cards. According to Insurgency Gaming,

"Each of these new commanders, once brought into play, allows the player who owns them to fly a Sortie at the beginning of each of their turns prior to making a standard attack.
FLYING A SORTIE
Each sortie flight takes part in three of distinct stages:
1. Outbound Flight
2. Bombing
3. Return Flight "

Purchase price includes two Aerial commanders and the 20 card deck.

Card distribution:

3 x Propaganda

3 x Resurrection
3 x phoenix
3 x Storm Troopers

2 x Kamikaze
2 x Aerial Assault
2 x Air Raid
1 x Dark Angel

Expands:


Risk 2210 A.D.
35891.name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Aerial Assault Command Deck

35892.name: Ley Lines
35892.description:
Ley Lines is played with a Piecepack Set and Dominoes. It was an entry in the LudicSynergy contest.

Each player is the head of an ancient druidic order, building geographic conduits, called ley lines (dominoes), through which mystic energy can be channeled from the sources of such energy, called cairns (coins), to the order's sacred druidic stronghold, a tor (pawn). Each suit represents a different druidic order: worshipers of the sun (suns), worshipers of the moon (moons), worshipers of mankind (crowns), and worshipers of nature (arms).

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35893.name: Fujisan
35893.description:
Four Shinto priests have traveled from their various prefectures in pilgrimage to the top of Mount Fuji. You must find pathways for them to move up and down the mountain until they can all achieve the summit. Often, this will require you to guide them into positions from which they can assist each other.

Rules can be found on Piecepack Wiki

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35894.name: Dungeon Crawl
35894.description:
After building the dungeon, players move their characters (pawns) around the dungeon seeking treasure (crown coins). Monstrous denizens (moon coins) and deadly traps (sun coins) pose hazards which may cause damage (value-up coins in players' holdings), but defeating these challenges earns experience useful for later encounters (suit-up coins in players' holdings). Players may also attack each other in an attempt to steal treasure or equipment (arms coins). Once the final treasure has been found, the game ends,and the player with the highest total value in treasure wins.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35895.name: San Andreas
35895.description:
The big one is coming! Don't wall in the Pacific Ocean.

Players place coins to establish cities and roll dice to determine when quakes will happen. Tiles will shift and cities will be destroyed. If your cities are closer to the Ocean at game end you'll have the most valuable property and win the game.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

35896.name: Succesvol slecht zijn
35896.description:
"Succesvol slecht zijn" (Succeed at being evil) is a card game in which the players have to complete several evil goals: they need to capture a princess, raise a monster, acquire a super weapon, etc.

There are two types of cards: red action cards and blue keeper cards. The blue cards represent the goals, and/or well as prerequisites that are needed to play other blue cards. Most of them will also give their owner some kind of special advantage.

The red cards are actions that will benefit the one who plays them (or harm somebody else).

Each turn, a player draws one card, and can then play up to one blue card and as many red cards as he wishes. The first player to achieve all the different goals wins the game.

boardgamehonor: 2003 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "Published games" Nominee
35897.name: Silben-Rallye
35897.description:
From the rules:
"In a playful way, the players together broaden their vocabulary, practice the structure of syllables and the rhythm of words.
...
Whoever is imaginative and eloquent in describing the motifs on the picture cards, will be the first to collect four different postcards.
...
Lets start with the zippy tour straight across Europe! The children travel by train, car, plane or boat and try to visit, as quickly as possible, four of five European capitals in order to collect postcards. It is however not so easy to move on as it doesn’t depend just on throwing the dice. Only the one who carefully looks at the pictures and proves to have enough imagination in describing them, will reach their aim."

35898.name: Back to Blighty
35898.description:
Back to Blighty is a diceless card game, which is played mainly with 4 decks of terrain cards and a player sheet.
